dependencies.description:
The NVIDIA HPC SDK is a comprehensive suite of compilers, libraries and
tools essential to maximizing developer productivity and the performance
and portability of HPC applications. The NVIDIA HPC SDK C, C++, and
Fortran compilers support GPU acceleration of HPC modeling and
simulation applications with standard C++ and Fortran, OpenACC
directives, and CUDA. GPU-accelerated math libraries maximize
performance on common HPC algorithms, and optimized communications
libraries enable standards-based multi-GPU and scalable systems
programming. Performance profiling and debugging tools simplify porting
and optimization of HPC applications.
dependencies.name: c

dependencies.description:
The NVIDIA HPC SDK is a comprehensive suite of compilers, libraries and
tools essential to maximizing developer productivity and the performance
and portability of HPC applications. The NVIDIA HPC SDK C, C++, and
Fortran compilers support GPU acceleration of HPC modeling and
simulation applications with standard C++ and Fortran, OpenACC
directives, and CUDA. GPU-accelerated math libraries maximize
performance on common HPC algorithms, and optimized communications
libraries enable standards-based multi-GPU and scalable systems
programming. Performance profiling and debugging tools simplify porting
and optimization of HPC applications.
dependencies.name: cxx

dependencies.description:
GNU Make is a tool which controls the generation of executables and
other non-source files of a program from the program's source files.
dependencies.name: gmake

dependencies.description:
The GNU config.guess and config.sub scripts versioned by timestamp.
This package can be used as a build dependency for autotools packages
that ship a tarball with outdated config.guess and config.sub files.
dependencies.name: gnuconfig

dependencies.description:
The ncurses (new curses) library is a free software emulation of curses
in System V Release 4.0, and more. It uses terminfo format, supports
pads and color and multiple highlights and forms characters and
function-key mapping, and has all the other SYSV-curses enhancements
over BSD curses.
dependencies.name: ncurses

dependencies.description:
Perl 5 is a highly capable, feature-rich programming language with over
27 years of development.
dependencies.name: perl

dependent_to.description:
FFTW (AMD Optimized version) is a comprehensive collection of fast C
routines for computing the Discrete Fourier Transform (DFT) and various
special cases thereof. It is an open-source implementation of the Fast
Fourier transform algorithm. It can compute transforms of real and
complex-values arrays of arbitrary size and dimension. AMD Optimized
FFTW is the optimized FFTW implementation targeted for AMD CPUs. For
single precision build, please use precision value as float. Example :
spack install amdfftw precision=float LICENSING INFORMATION: By
downloading, installing and using this software, you agree to the terms
and conditions of the AMD AOCL-FFTW license agreement. You may obtain a
copy of this license agreement from
https://www.amd.com/en/developer/aocl/fftw/eula/fftw-
libraries-4-2-eula.html
https://www.amd.com/en/developer/aocl/fftw/eula/fftw-libraries-eula.html
dependent_to.name: amdfftw

dependent_to.description:
bc is an arbitrary precision numeric processing language. Syntax is
similar to C, but differs in many substantial areas. It supports
interactive execution of statements.
dependent_to.name: bc

dependent_to.description: GNU binutils, which contain the linker, assembler, objdump and others
dependent_to.name: binutils

dependent_to.description:
BppSuite is a suite of ready-to-use programs for phylogenetic and
sequence analysis.
dependent_to.name: bpp-suite

dependent_to.description: A curses front-end to GDB
dependent_to.name: cgdb

dependent_to.description:
CLN is a library for efficient computations with all kinds of numbers in
arbitrary precision. It features number classes for unlimited length
integers, rationals, arbitrary precision floating point numbers and much
more.
dependent_to.name: cln

dependent_to.description:
It provides the filesystem utilities for use with the ext2 filesystem.
It also supports the ext3 and ext4 filesystems.
dependent_to.name: e2fsprogs

dependent_to.description:
Emacs is an extensible, customizable, free/libre text editor. At its
core is an interpreter for Emacs Lisp, a dialect of the Lisp programming
language with extensions to support text editing.
dependent_to.name: emacs

dependent_to.description:
FFmpeg is a complete, cross-platform solution to record, convert and
stream audio and video.
dependent_to.name: ffmpeg

dependent_to.description:
FFTW (Fujitsu Optimized version) is a comprehensive collection of fast C
routines for computing the Discrete Fourier Transform (DFT) and various
special cases thereof. It is an open-source implementation of the Fast
Fourier transform algorithm. It can compute transforms of real and
complex-values arrays of arbitrary size and dimension. Fujitsu Optimized
FFTW is the optimized FFTW implementation targeted for A64FX CPUs. For
single precision build, please use precision value as float. Example :
spack install fujitsufftw precision=float
dependent_to.name: fujitsu-fftw

dependent_to.description:
The GNU Compiler Collection includes front ends for C, C++, Objective-C,
Fortran, Ada, and Go, as well as libraries for these languages.
dependent_to.name: gcc

dependent_to.description:
GDB, the GNU Project debugger, allows you to see what is going on
'inside' another program while it executes -- or what another program
was doing at the moment it crashed.
dependent_to.name: gdb

dependent_to.description: Tool to write command line option parsing code for C programs
dependent_to.name: gengetopt

dependent_to.description:
The GNU C Library provides many of the low-level components used
directly by programs written in the C or C++ languages.
dependent_to.name: glibc

dependent_to.description:
Groff (GNU troff) is a typesetting system that reads plain text mixed
with formatting commands and produces formatted output. Output may be
PostScript or PDF, html, or ASCII/UTF8 for display at the terminal.
dependent_to.name: groff

dependent_to.description:
Inspector/Executor Generation Library for manipulating sets and
relations with uninterpreted function symbols.
dependent_to.name: iegenlib

dependent_to.description: C/C++ Configuration File Library
dependent_to.name: libconfig

dependent_to.description: libtool -- library building part of autotools.
dependent_to.name: libtool

dependent_to.description:
This library provides functions for manipulating Unicode strings and for
manipulating C strings according to the Unicode standard.
dependent_to.name: libunistring

dependent_to.description: Library for arbitrary precision interval arithmetic based on MPFR
dependent_to.name: mpfi

dependent_to.description:
The MPFR library is a C library for multiple-precision floating-point
computations with correct rounding.
dependent_to.name: mpfr

dependent_to.description:
The NCO toolkit manipulates and analyzes data stored in netCDF-
accessible formats
dependent_to.name: nco

dependent_to.description:
GNU Octave is a high-level language, primarily intended for numerical
computations. It provides a convenient command line interface for
solving linear and nonlinear problems numerically, and for performing
other numerical experiments using a language that is mostly compatible
with Matlab. It may also be used as a batch-oriented language.
dependent_to.name: octave

dependent_to.description: Application Profiling, Tracing, and Analysis
dependent_to.name: omnitrace

dependent_to.description: Pinfo is user-friendly, console-based viewer for Info documents.
dependent_to.name: pinfo

dependent_to.description: Process-in-Process
dependent_to.name: process-in-process

dependent_to.description:
R is 'GNU S', a freely available language and environment for
statistical computing and graphics which provides a wide variety of
statistical and graphical techniques: linear and nonlinear modelling,
statistical tests, time series analysis, classification, clustering,
etc. Please consult the R project homepage for further information.
dependent_to.name: r

dependent_to.description: A cross-compilation tool for RISC-V.
dependent_to.name: riscv-gnu-toolchain

dependent_to.description: set of AMD specific device-side language runtime libraries
dependent_to.name: rocm-device-libs

dependent_to.description:
This is ROCmgdb, the ROCm source-level debugger for Linux, based on GDB,
the GNU source-level debugger.
dependent_to.name: rocm-gdb

dependent_to.description: Application Profiling, Tracing, and Analysis
dependent_to.name: rocprofiler-systems

dependent_to.description:
Sherpa is a Monte Carlo event generator for the Simulation of High-
Energy Reactions of PArticles in lepton-lepton, lepton-photon, photon-
photon, lepton-hadron and hadron-hadron collisions.
dependent_to.name: sherpa

dependent_to.description:
This program, given a source file, produces a document with syntax
highlighting. It also provides a C++ highlight library (since version
3.0).
dependent_to.name: source-highlight

description:
Texinfo is the official documentation format of the GNU project. It was
invented by Richard Stallman and Bob Chassell many years ago, loosely
based on Brian Reid's Scribe and other formatting languages of the time.
It is used by many non-GNU projects as well.
name: texinfo

variants.description: Build systems supported by the package
variants.name: build_system
